alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Kennebec; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 12:26AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Kennebec, central Oxford, northeastern Androscoggin, northwestern Cumberland and southwestern Franklin Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1226 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Grafton to 6 miles northeast of Bridgton. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Bridgton, Bethel, Rumford, Turner, Jay, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Canton, Andover, Waterford, Grafton, Wilton, Phillips, Weld, Mexico, Harrison, Leeds, Livermore and Buckfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Kennebec; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford
